intro: Myrsine verrucosa subsp. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved myrsine, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, red berries. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
